name: Phishing Email

tasks.description:
_Objective:  Gather events from various sources (log files, error messages,etc.) in order to determine if an incident has occurred.  If an incident has occurred, determine scope and parties involved.  This is also the phase where incident responders should be documenting everything that they are doing, as stated earlier these documents should be able to answer the Who, What, Where, Why, and How questions._

**Upload Observables**
* Email
* Attachment Hash
* URLs
* URL IP 
* Sender Address 
* Sender IP 
* IP Address of O365 portal login

**Run Analyzers**
* Run applicable analyzers
tasks.title: Identification

tasks.description:
_Objective: Limit the damage and prevent any further damage from happening. Short term containment followed by long term solution._

* Block access to URL with ATP or by requesting firewall shun.
tasks.title: Containment

tasks.description:
_Objective: Ensure all proper steps were taken to remove malicious and other illicit content and all systems have been restored to a clean stated._

* Remove email from inbox.
tasks.title: Eradication

tasks.description:
_Objective: Ensure all proper steps were taken to remove malicious and other illicit content and all systems have been restored to a clean stated._

* Ensure fraudulent pages are blocked by ATP/firewall.
tasks.title: Recovery

tasks.description:
_Objective: Complete any documentation that was not done during the incident, as well as any additional documentation that may be beneficial in future incidents._

**PhishER**
* If applicable, create YARA rules to identify future reports of similar messages. 

**MISP **
* Publish data to MISP. 

**ServiceNow **
* Close ticket if applicable.
tasks.title: Lessons Learned

description: An email has been received, purporting to be from a reputable company or individual, in order to lead to the revelation of personal information, such as passwords and credit card numbers.
